question: [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: RocksdbConfigs] [Thread Pool Exhaustion] Can high_priority_background_threads or low_priority_background_threads be set to extreme values at lines 204-205, causing either thread exhaustion or thread starvation that degrades compaction and flush operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: RocksdbConfigs] [Shared Cache Starvation] Can shared_block_cache_size be set to near-zero values at line 207, causing cache thrashing where all databases compete for minimal cache space, leading to excessive disk I/O and consensus timeouts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: RocksdbConfigs] [Cache Allocation Attack] Can shared_block_cache_size be set to values exceeding available system memory (usize::MAX), causing OOM errors when RocksDB attempts to allocate the cache during initialization? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: RocksdbConfigs] [Per-DB Config Conflict] Can conflicting configurations between ledger_db_config, state_merkle_db_config, state_kv_db_config, and index_db_config cause resource contention or unexpected behavior when databases compete for shared resources? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: RocksdbConfigs] [Default Override Attack] Do the different default bloom filter settings for state_kv_db_config at lines 224-227 versus other configs create performance asymmetries that can be exploited to target specific database operations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: LedgerPrunerConfig] [Prune Window Underflow] Can prune_window be set to 0 or 1 at line 306, causing aggressive pruning that deletes data still needed by in-flight transactions or state sync operations, leading to state inconsistencies? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: LedgerPrunerConfig] [Batch Size Attack] Can batch_size be set to usize::MAX at line 310, causing the pruner to attempt pruning all historical data in a single batch, triggering memory exhaustion and node crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: LedgerPrunerConfig] [User Pruning Offset Manipulation] Can user_pruning_window_offset at line 312 be manipulated to exceed prune_window, causing the API to refuse all historical queries and breaking archive node functionality? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: LedgerPrunerConfig] [Integer Overflow in Pruning] Can prune_window (u64) overflow when added to current version during pruning calculations, causing incorrect pruning boundaries that delete recent critical data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: StateMerklePrunerConfig] [State Merkle Prune Race] Can prune_window at line 322 be set too small (e.g., 1000), causing state merkle nodes to be pruned while still referenced by concurrent block execution, leading to execution failures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: StateMerklePrunerConfig] [Batch Size Starvation] Can batch_size at line 324 be set to 1, causing pruning to become so slow that the database grows unboundedly, eventually exhausting disk space and crashing the validator? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: EpochSnapshotPrunerConfig] [Snapshot Availability Attack] Can prune_window for epoch snapshots at line 333 be set too aggressively, causing fast sync nodes to fail when attempting to sync from epoch snapshots that have already been pruned? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: EpochSnapshotPrunerConfig] [State Sync Dependency] If epoch_snapshot_pruner_config is disabled while state sync relies on epoch snapshots, can this cause new nodes joining the network to fail synchronization, harming network decentralization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Const: NO_OP_STORAGE_PRUNER_CONFIG] [Pruner Disable Attack] If all pruners are disabled using NO_OP_STORAGE_PRUNER_CONFIG at lines 278-295, can the database grow unboundedly until disk exhaustion occurs, causing validator node crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: StorageConfig] [Backup Service Port] Can backup_service_address at line 244 be configured to bind to 0.0.0.0 or a public IP, exposing the backup service to unauthorized access and potential data exfiltration? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: StorageConfig] [Directory Traversal] Can the dir field at line 246 accept path traversal sequences (../) that bypass intended storage locations and write database files to system directories? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: StorageConfig] [Data Directory Override] Is the data_dir field at line 251 properly validated and sanitized, or can it be set to sensitive system directories (/etc, /root) causing security violations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: StorageConfig] [Buffered State Underflow] Can buffered_state_target_items at line 258 be set to 0, causing constant state dumps that exhaust I/O and prevent normal block processing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: StorageConfig] [Buffered State Overflow] Can buffered_state_target_items be set to usize::MAX, preventing state dumps entirely and causing unbounded memory growth until OOM crashes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: StorageConfig] [LRU Cache Bypass] Can max_num_nodes_per_lru_cache_shard at line 260 be set to 0 or 1, effectively disabling caching and causing catastrophic performance degradation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: StorageConfig] [LRU Cache Exhaustion] Can max_num_nodes_per_lru_cache_shard be set to usize::MAX, causing excessive memory allocation (potentially terabytes based on 16 shards) leading to OOM? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: StorageConfig] [Indexer State Mismatch] Can enable_indexer at line 267 be toggled after genesis without proper indexer DB initialization, causing index corruption or missing transaction indices? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: StorageConfig] [Path Override Without Sharding] Can db_path_overrides at line 271 be set when enable_storage_sharding is false, bypassing the sanitizer check and causing configuration inconsistencies? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: StorageConfig] [RLIMIT Bypass] Can ensure_rlimit_nofile at line 273 be set to values below system requirements, causing the node to run out of file descriptors during high load? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/storage_config.rs] [Struct: StorageConfig] [RLIMIT Assert Crash] When assert_rlimit_nofile is true at line 275 but the system cannot meet the requirement, does the node crash during startup, and can this be exploited to cause persistent validator unavailability?
